channel.title: NPR Topics: News
channel.description: NPR news, audio, and podcasts. Coverage of breaking stories, national and world news, politics, business, science, technology, and extended coverage of major national and world events.
channel.copyright: Copyright 2024 NPR - For Personal Use Only

item.title: A low-carb diet may help IBS as much as tricky elimination diets, and more than drugs
item.description: The standard advice for symptoms of IBS is either medication or a tough-to-follow diet called low FODMAP. A new study finds both that diet and the much simpler low-carb diet brought more relief than drugs.
item.content:encoded:
The standard advice for symptoms of IBS is either medication or a tough-to-follow diet called low FODMAP. A new study finds both that diet and the much simpler low-carb diet brought more relief than drugs.

(Image credit: d3sign/Getty Images)
item.dc:creator: Ronnie Cohen

item.title: Violence clouds the last day of campaigning before Sunday's elections in Mexico
item.description: Some 27 candidates, mostly running for mayor or town councils, have been killed so far this year. But criminals have taken to mass shootings rather than targeted attacks as they have in the past.
item.content:encoded:
Some 27 candidates, mostly running for mayor or town councils, have been killed so far this year. But criminals have taken to mass shootings rather than targeted attacks as they have in the past.

(Image credit: Fernando Llano)
item.dc:creator: The Associated Press

item.title: Biden’s problems with younger voters are glaring, poll finds
item.description: Younger voters have been a crucial voting bloc for Democrats, but President Biden is facing real challenges — and it's part of why his race with former President Donald Trump is so tight.
item.content:encoded:
Younger voters have been a crucial voting bloc for Democrats, but President Biden is facing real challenges — and it's part of why his race with former President Donald Trump is so tight.

(Image credit: Andrew Harnik)
item.dc:creator: Domenico Montanaro

item.title: RFK's voters know they're not electing the next president. They're with him anyway
item.description: The winner of this year's presidential race could be decided by who shows up to support independent candidate Robert F. Kennedy, Jr. -- and who that means they aren't voting for.
item.content:encoded:
The winner of this year's presidential race could be decided by who shows up to support independent candidate Robert F. Kennedy, Jr. -- and who that means they aren't voting for.

(Image credit: JOSH EDELSON/AFP via Getty Images)
item.dc:creator: Stephen Fowler

item.title: Hong Kong court convicts 14 pro-democracy activists, acquits 2
item.description: The convictions of the activists was the city’s biggest national security case to date under a law imposed by Beijing that has all but wiped out public dissent.
item.content:encoded:
The convictions of the activists was the city’s biggest national security case to date under a law imposed by Beijing that has all but wiped out public dissent.

(Image credit: Chan Long Hei/AP)
item.dc:creator: Associated Press

item.title: Minnesota becomes the inaugural champion of the Professional Women's Hockey League
item.description: The trophy was presented to the team by tennis legend Billie Jean King, who is a founding advisory board member for the league, which currently has six teams.
item.content:encoded:
The trophy was presented to the team by tennis legend Billie Jean King, who is a founding advisory board member for the league, which currently has six teams.

(Image credit: Abbie Parr)
item.dc:creator: Ayana Archie

item.title: 'Bad breath rapist' from Boston area caught after 16 years at large in California
item.description: Tuen Kit Lee was found guilty in 2007 of the kidnapping and rape of the young woman at knifepoint near Boston. He was located in California after images of him emerged on social media.
item.content:encoded:
Tuen Kit Lee was found guilty in 2007 of the kidnapping and rape of the young woman at knifepoint near Boston. He was located in California after images of him emerged on social media.

(Image credit: U.S. Marshals Service)
item.dc:creator: The Associated Press

item.title: Battle of Chinese and Taiwanese Chatbots and a Balloon Battle Between the Koreas
item.description:
Taiwan has developed a large language model artificial intelligence chat bot to compete with a product from China because of fears regarding national security. And North Korea sends garbage-filled balloons over the border into South Korea, escalating a long-standing balloon battle between the Koreas.

Sign up for State of the World+ to listen sponsor-free and support the work of NPR journalists. Visit plus.npr.org.
item.content:encoded:
Taiwan has developed a large language model artificial intelligence chat bot to compete with a product from China because of fears regarding national security. And North Korea sends garbage-filled balloons over the border into South Korea, escalating a long-standing balloon battle between the Koreas.

item.dc:creator: Emily Feng

item.title: How the pandemic gave power to superbugs
item.description: A surprising outcome of the COVID pandemic has been the rise of antibiotic-resistant infections. How did that happen?
item.content:encoded:
A surprising outcome of the COVID pandemic has been the rise of antibiotic-resistant infections. How did that happen?

(Image credit: -)
item.dc:creator: Gabrielle Emanuel

item.title: American Airlines faces a discrimination suit after removing 8 Black men from flight
item.description: Neither passenger knew each other, nor were they seated together on the Jan. 5 flight from Phoenix to New York. A lawsuit alleges they were removed from the flight after a complaint about body odor.
item.content:encoded:
Neither passenger knew each other, nor were they seated together on the Jan. 5 flight from Phoenix to New York. A lawsuit alleges they were removed from the flight after a complaint about body odor.

(Image credit: Kiichiro Sato)
item.dc:creator: Jonathan Franklin
